decks.notes: The main idea of this Legacy Belcher deck is to quickly generate mana and cast spells to build up to casting Goblin Charbelcher, which can then be activated to deal a massive amount of damage to the opponent's life total. The deck includes cards like Rite of Flame, Seething Song, and Lotus Petal to accelerate mana production, as well as Burning Wish to tutor for specific cards as needed. The goal is to assemble the necessary pieces quickly and efficiently to execute the combo and win the game.

This deck focuses on early aggression with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Delver of Secrets, supported by disruption spells like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize. It aims to control the board with cards like Abrupt Decay and Liliana of the Veil while maintaining tempo advantage with cards like Daze and Force of Will. The mana base is carefully constructed to support a wide range of spells, ensuring consistency in both aggression and disruption. The deck seeks to apply pressure early and disrupt the opponent's game plan, leading to a quick victory.

This deck focuses on dealing damage quickly and efficiently to the opponent through a combination of burn spells and aggressive creatures. By maximizing direct damage spells like Chain Lightning, Lightning Bolt, and Price of Progress, it aims to chip away at the opponent's life total while also controlling the board with cards like Searing Blaze. The inclusion of creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Eidolon of the Great Revel provides additional pressure and ensures a constant stream of damage. With a streamlined mana base and efficient spells, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck is focused on dealing damage quickly and efficiently by utilizing creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, along with a variety of burn spells like Chain Lightning, Rift Bolt, and Lava Spike. The goal is to constantly pressure the opponent's life total while also preventing them from gaining life with cards like Sulfuric Vortex. With the high amount of direct damage spells and aggressive creatures, this deck aims to close out the game as quickly as possible before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using cheap and efficient burn spells, along with aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear. The key strategy is to maintain pressure on the opponent by consistently hitting them with burn spells and creatures, while also leveraging cards like Price of Progress to punish opponents for playing non-basic lands. The deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize or gain too much life, prioritizing speed and direct damage output.

The deck focuses on playing low-cost, aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Stifle. The deck also includes cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to manipulate the top of the library for optimal draws. With a strong mana base of dual lands and fetch lands, as well as burn spells like Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to apply pressure early while controlling the board to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying constant pressure with efficient creatures. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker to slow down the opponent's spells, combined with land disruption from Wasteland and Rishadan Port, the deck aims to control the game tempo. With the addition of powerful equipment like Swords to Plowshares and Umezawa's Jitte, the deck can quickly close out games while maintaining board presence. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt and outpace the opponent in order to secure victory.

The primary idea of this Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base by using cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon, while also putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Moggcatcher. The deck aims to control the pace of the game by utilizing prison-style elements such as Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void, while also having the potential for explosive plays with cards like Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Siege-Gang Commander. The deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm opponents. By utilizing fast mana sources like Simian Spirit Guide and Ancient Tomb, this deck aims to play large threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer ahead of curve. Chalice of the Void helps disrupt opponents' game plans, while cards like Dismember provide removal options. The deck also includes utility lands like Wasteland and Karakas to disrupt opponents, and Eye of Ugin to search for more Eldrazi threats. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain board control throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deploy powerful Eldrazi creatures by utilizing powerful lands like Cavern of Souls, Eldrazi Temple, and Ancient Tomb. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst to slow down the opponent. By combining aggressive creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer with mana acceleration from cards like Simian Spirit Guide, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient threats while disrupting their game plan with cards like Warping Wail and Dismember.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive Eldrazi creatures early on by utilizing mana acceleration like Simian Spirit Guide and Ancient Tomb. It also disrupts opponent's game plan with Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Endbringer while also controlling the board with removal spells like Dismember. The mana base includes lands like Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin to maximize the deck's potential and ensure consistent plays throughout the game.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on early aggressive plays with Eldrazi creatures like Eldrazi Mimic, Matter Reshaper, and Reality Smasher. The deck also aims to disrupt opponents' strategies with cards like Thought-Knot Seer, Chalice of the Void, and Thorn of Amethyst. It has mana acceleration with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Ancient Tomb to play its threats ahead of curve. The deck includes versatile cards like Warping Wail and Umezawa's Jitte for added utility. The land base includes powerful lands like Eye of Ugin and Cavern of Souls to support the Eldrazi tribal theme.

The key concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly deploy powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Eldrazi Displacer to apply early pressure on the opponent. With multiple ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan, such as Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and close out the game before the opponent can recover. With a mana curve focused on fast acceleration and efficient creatures, this deck is designed to be aggressive and proactive in its strategy.

The deck focuses on generating a large number of Elf creatures to create a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith to quickly draw through the deck and search for key combo pieces like Craterhoof Behemoth and Natural Order. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Magus of the Moon to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is heavily focused on efficiently producing green mana to maximize the potential of Gaea's Cradle and win the game through explosive turns.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells. With a mix of powerful threats like Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, and Young Pyromancer, as well as disruption in the form of counterspells like Daze and Force of Will, the deck aims to pressure the opponent while taking control of the game. Utilizing card draw with Ponder and Brainstorm, along with versatile removal like Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to quickly close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This Grixis Aggro deck aims to put early pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler while disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Daze and Force of Will. By utilizing cards like Deathrite Shaman and Gitaxian Probe, the deck can further disrupt the opponent's resources. The deck also has access to removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Kolaghan's Command to clear the opponent's threats. The mana base is built around fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to all three colors.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Daze, Force of Will, and Stifle. The deck also includes versatile removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate to deal with opposing threats. By combining aggressive creatures with disruptive spells, this deck aims to pressure the opponent while controlling the board, ultimately overwhelming them and securing a victory. The mana base consists of fetch lands to ensure consistent access to all three colors of mana.

This Legacy Combo - High Tide deck focuses on generating large amounts of mana by chaining together High Tide spells and untapping lands with Turnabout. It uses card draw and filtering spells like Ponder and Preordain to find the necessary combo pieces quickly. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. Cunning Wish allows for additional flexibility in finding key cards from the sideboard. The goal is to generate enough mana to cast a game-winning spell like Time Spiral or Past in Flames.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board through a combination of discard spells, removal, and mana denial with cards like Liliana of the Veil, Abrupt Decay, Wasteland, and Punishing Fire. It uses Life from the Loam to recur lands and find utility lands like Karakas and Maze of Ith. Knight of the Reliquary provides additional utility by tutoring for key lands, while Dark Confidant and Sylvan Library allow for card advantage. Chalice of the Void disrupts opponent's game plan, while the Green Sun's Zenith package offers flexibility in finding key creatures like Gaddock Teeg or Scavenging Ooze.

The deck aims to control the game by utilizing cards like Dark Confidant, Liliana of the Veil, and Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also utilizes the Life from the Loam engine with Knight of the Reliquary and Punishing Fire to generate value and maintain board presence. The deck leans heavily on resource denial with cards like Wasteland and punishing the opponent's key threats with cards like Abrupt Decay. The ultimate goal is to assemble the Dark Depths/Thespian's Stage combo for a quick and powerful win condition.

This Merfolk deck focuses on quickly deploying and buffing creatures, overwhelming opponents with aggressive board presence. It utilizes Merfolk lords like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident to boost its creatures' power and toughness. True-Name Nemesis provides a difficult-to-deal-with threat, while disruption elements like Cursecatcher and Force of Will help control the game. Aether Vial and Chalice of the Void offer additional utility and disruption, while Mutavault and Wasteland provide mana fixing and land disruption options. The deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain tempo throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting, then bringing them back onto the battlefield with Reanimate spells. The key strategy is to cheat big creatures like Griselbrand, Iona, and Elesh Norn into play early on to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to react. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Chancellor of the Annex and Cabal Therapy to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Iona, Shield of Emeria using cards like Careful Study and Entomb, then utilizing cards like Exhume and Reanimate to bring them back onto the battlefield for a quick victory. It includes disruption spells like Daze and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and interaction spells like Force of Will to stop opponent's plays. The deck aims to win the game before the opponent can set up their own strategy, utilizing the powerful synergy between reanimation and powerful creatures.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while deploying threats efficiently. With a mix of disruptive spells like Force of Will and Hymn to Tourach, along with powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Shardless Agent, the deck aims to control the game tempo and maintain board presence. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil provides additional value and versatility. By utilizing a combination of removal, card advantage, and efficient threats, the deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory through a proactive game plan.

The deck focuses on using efficient creatures and planeswalkers to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building card advantage and applying pressure. By combining powerful threat cards like Tarmogoyf and Shardless Agent with disruptive elements like Liliana of the Veil and Hymn to Tourach, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful cantrips like Brainstorm and Ancestral Vision along with countermagic like Force of Will helps the deck maintain card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategies.

This deck focuses on controlling the board while applying pressure with efficient creatures. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with powerful disruption spells like Hymn to Tourach and Force of Will, while generating card advantage through Ancestral Vision and Shardless Agent. The deck also utilizes versatile removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Maelstrom Pulse to deal with threats. With a solid mana base and a mix of planeswalkers and versatile creatures, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win through efficient use of resources.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while efficiently deploying threats to apply pressure. Utilizing a mix of hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful creatures, it aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of cascade cards like Shardless Agent allows for additional value and card advantage, while mana denial with Wasteland can slow down the opponent's game plan. With a mix of control elements and aggressive threats, this deck aims to adapt to different matchups and gain incremental advantages to secure a victory.

The primary focus of this deck is to maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's strategy with a combination of powerful spells and creatures. Using a mixture of removal spells like Abrupt Decay and creatures like Tarmogoyf and Shardless Agent, the deck aims to pressure the opponent while also generating card advantage with instants like Brainstorm and Ancestral Vision. Additionally, cards like Deathrite Shaman and Liliana of the Veil provide additional disruption and ways to control the game. Ultimately, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board while deploying a steady stream of threats. It utilizes powerful disruption spells like Hymn to Tourach and Force of Will, along with efficient removal like Abrupt Decay. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Ancestral Vision and Shardless Agent, allowing for consistent pressure. Tarmogoyf and other efficient creatures provide a clock for the opponent to deal with, while planeswalkers like Jace and Liliana provide additional value and control. The deck aims to grind out the opponent while maintaining pressure on multiple fronts.

This deck is focused on combining infect creatures with Blazing Shoal to deal lethal damage to the opponent quickly. With cards like Berserk and Vines of Vastwood to pump up your creatures, along with protection spells like Force of Will and Daze, the goal is to sneak through damage before the opponent can react. Gitaxian Probe and Brainstorm help to dig for combo pieces, while Noble Hierarch and Blighted Agent provide additional infect threats. Progenitus serves as a backup win condition if the infect plan doesn't work out. It is important to carefully manage resources and timing to execute the combo efficiently.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly and efficiently cheat big creatures into play using cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience. By putting powerful threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play for little to no mana cost, the strategy aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to respond. The deck also includes a mix of cantrips, counterspells, and card selection spells to help find the necessary combo pieces and protect the combo from disruption.

The deck revolves around playing a high number of low-cost cantrips and rituals to build up mana quickly and efficiently, leading to a massive storm count for Tendrils of Agony to finish off the opponent in one turn. It also includes disruptive cards like Duress and Cabal Therapy to control the opponent's hand and clear the way for the combo to go off. The inclusion of Past in Flames allows for extra recursion, ensuring that the combo can be repeated if disrupted. Overall, the deck focuses on explosive plays and comboing off as fast as possible.

This deck utilizes cards that can quickly and efficiently generate mana and card advantage to cast a large number of spells in a single turn. By using cards like Rite of Flame, Dark Ritual, and Lion's Eye Diamond, the deck can build up enough storm count to win the game in one explosive turn. The combo pieces include cards like Infernal Tutor and Burning Wish to search for win conditions like Empty the Warrens or Ad Nauseam. The deck also includes disruption elements like Cabal Therapy and Duress to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's plays with a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage provided by cards like Sensei's Divining Top and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck aims to control the game tempo through cards like Counterbalance and Terminus, while also utilizing creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Angels to close out the game. By managing the opponent's threats and card advantage, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through incremental advantage.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through card advantage and manipulation. By using cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Snapcaster Mage, and Monastery Mentor, alongside powerful spells such as Ponder, Terminus, Swords to Plowshares, and Force of Will, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With cards like Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to manipulate the top of the deck, the deck can consistently answer threats and maintain control of the game. The mana base is carefully constructed to support its diverse spell options.
